Floridians with homeowner , commercial and liability insurance polices will pay a third 2 percent surcharge to help cover claims from the recent string of severe storms and tornadoes, the state Office of Insurance Regulation announced. The fee is the second surcharge imposed by the state insurance department following Hurricane Matthew and Tropical Storm Irma. The storms caused $250 million in damage to homes and businesses statewide. "The Department of Financial Services continues to push for passage of a bill in the Legislature to create a dedicated hurricane fund, but Florida families and businesses need relief now," said Florida Insurance Commissioner David Altmaier.

column1: ZURICH ( Reuters ) - Switzerland will introduce a quota system allowing Britons to come and work in the country after Brexit despite opposition from business and trade unions. Switzerland’s cabinet on Friday approved a system which aims to protect the Swiss labour market from an influx of unskilled workers from Britain as it prepares for Brexit. Swiss businesses say they will have to pay more and face recruitment problems if the number of British workers is cut off from the European Union. Switzerland has been in talks with Britain about special access for Britons to work in Switzerland after Brexit.

Error led to more drastic original calculation for K-State Research and Extension . By Amy Bickel - The Hutchinson News 06/10/2008
The Kansas Board of Regents is correcting a mathematical error, and the corrected error will lead to higher budget reductions for Kansas State University and other public universities. The error led to more drastic calculations for a 10 percent reduction in state funding for Kansas State University. K-State was previously scheduled to lose 10 percent of the total state appropriations it received in 2007. The error will now cause a loss of $3.25 million, or 12.25 percent of K-State’s total state appropriations in 2007.

Australia 's newest young migrants are overwhelmingly optimistic about the future - but that does n't last long . column1: The researchers at Rice University in the US engineered scaffolds that replicate the physical characteristics of osteochondral tissue - hard tissue that protects cartilage underneath. "Through our research we have uncovered the key molecule that determines what kind of cells our scaffolds turn into - the cells that are important for the cartilage tissue to function properly," said Ting.

SEATTLE ( AP )  A federal jury convicted the son of a Russian lawmaker Thursday of hacking into U.S. businesses and government agencies on behalf of an Eastern European group that has spied on governments and corporations for clients around the world, federal officials said. Dmitriy Smilianets, 32, was charged in a 2011 indictment with helping the group, known as the "Fancy Bear" hacking group, steal millions of sensitive emails, documents and other information from U.S. political organizations and government agencies, including the White House. Prosecutors accused him in 2011 of selling stolen information for as much as $1.5 million.

column1: Rumours spread across the internet yesterday that YouTube had been hacked . According to Chris Boyd , malware researcher at GFI Software , the claim was false. The seal is a way for web users to know that they're visiting a secure website. If you've been on the internet in the last few years , you've probably encountered phishing attempts. Phishing is a scam in which hackers use fraudulent websites to attempt to steal your credentials.

column1: DETROIT — Experts say a bright light and what sounded like thunder in the sky above Michigan was a meteor breaking up over the state. The National Weather Service office in Michigan got a call Thursday from someone reporting seeing a “bright light in the night sky” and a loud noise like that of a truck backing up. Meteorologist Chris O'Keefe told The Associated Press that the bright flash of light was likely caused by a meteor as it broke up over southeast Michigan. O'Keefe said a meteor is basically a chunk of rock from space that heats up and vaporizes as it moves through the atmosphere.

WASHINGTON ( MarketWatch ) -- U.S. consumer sentiment dropped to the lowest level in nearly 28 years in May as gas prices pushed up concern about the inflation, according to the University of Michigan's Surveys of Consumers index released on Friday. The index reading of 84.1 was the lowest since December 1974, below the 84.9 expected by economists surveyed by MarketWatch. The April reading was revised up to 88.5 from 88.3. Prices paid for gasoline are a big problem for consumers. The consumer sentiment index includes a "gas-price index" component that was at 103.8, the lowest level since the inception of the index in 1970.

column1: Eczema is an inflammation of the epidermis that may describe a broad range of skin conditions . It ’ s typically categorized as a type of dermatitis and it can be due to many causes. The most common symptom of eczema is skin inflammation or eczema, also known as eczematous dermatitis or dermatitis.

column1: Iran has arrested more than 100 Christians in the last week , charities report , amid a growing crackdown by the Islamic authorities . Christians and human rights activists are increasingly critical of the arrests, which come amid fears of an "unprecedented" crackdown on freedom of speech and religion by hard-liners who have tightened Iran's laws since the country's disputed presidential election earlier this year, the Christian Post has reported. The charities said Iran's secret police and intelligence services had arrested a total of 102 Christians in recent days, with 80 of those released after being interrogated by security agents.

The Federal Reserve for the first time would police banks ’ pay policies to make sure they don ’ t discriminate against minorities. The regulation announced Thursday by Fed Chair Janet Yellen would require lenders to report data on the income and employment levels of borrowers. The data could be analyzed to determine if banks are paying different rates based on factors such as income
column2: gender or race. The rule is a response to concerns that some banks are steering credit card applicants with lower scores to credit card issuers that have higher interest rates
column3: even though the applicants are just as creditworthy as other applicants who are offered the lower rate.

NEW HAVEN , Conn. ( AP ) — Police say a car crashed into the Mill River in New Haven and the driver is believed to have drowned. Police said in a statement posted on their website that the crash occurred around 2:00 a.m. Sunday and a search for the driver, identified as 27-year-old Yoel Perez, was unsuccessful. The car was found submerged. Police say Perez was found in the car by divers about 5:50 a.m.
Police did not say how many people were injured in the crash or how many passengers Perez had with him. It wasn’t immediately known if any passengers escaped the vehicle.

C) Climate change is a natural cycle of our planet which we have no control over

Scientists have now determined that it is indeed a combination of all the above. The planet is cooling at a record pace, but that will not stop climate change deniers.

A Russian official said Thursday that Moscow would consider a proposal from the United States for a new nuclear pact. "We have already spoken about this proposal from the United States and we would be willing to consider it," deputy head of the foreign ministry's European affairs department, Alexander Yakovenko, told reporters in Moscow. The U.S.-Russian agreement would be a bilateral pact with other major nuclear powers as a follow-on to the global treaty on nuclear nonproliferation, signed in 1968 by 181 nations. The treaty's signers committed to forgo the bomb in exchange for other nations' agreement to do the same.

Science is not a democracy . But as Paul Willis explains , the consilience of evidence for theories such as the Theory of Evolution is indeed possible in science . We can compare a theory against observations and predictions to decide which one is "best fit". For example, Newton's laws of motion , the Theory of General Relativity , and Quantum Theory are all well tested and used in very different areas of physics . So it's possible to use the theory of evolution to describe the origin of the universe or explain why there are galaxies billions of light years away and yet we can see them now.

EDMONTON – A man is recovering at the University of Alberta hospital in Edmonton after being attacked by a bear near Maskwacis, north of Edmonton. According to the Maskwacis RCMP, officers were called to a residence in the Morinville First Nation at about 3:30 a.m. on Saturday after reports of an injured man at a neighbouring property. The man, who has not been identified, had been attacked by a “black bear.”
The man suffered deep cuts to his abdomen, arms and legs, was unconscious and had to be resuscitated by medical personnel. He was transported to hospital by helicopter.

column4: Poland
column5: Czechoslovakia
column6: Romania

column1: China has joined the U.S. and Russia as one of only three nations to make a controlled soft landing of a spacecraft on the moon. The successful mission of China's Chang'e 3 lunar probe ended with a "soft landing" Sunday, state media reported, a first for the nation. "The spacecraft Chang'e 3 entered the planned landing area on Mare Imbrium," Xinhua News Agency reported. "According to the preliminary data, the landing was successful. It is now under control." "Chang'e" is the Chinese goddess of the Moon.

RALEIGH , N.C. ( AP ) — Hurricane Florence is testing the resolve of farmers in the Carolinas , who worry that a prolonged inundation of water will drown their livelihoods and flood their homes in the storm-battered region. In North Carolina alone , 4,300 farms and 6.9 million farm animals were already in Florence's crosshairs . About 9,000 farms are in South Carolina , with a similar number of animals. "Florence will probably be the most expensive storm for agriculture that the country has ever seen," said Chad Hart, a University of Tennessee economist who has been researching how storms impact farmers.

Is Tax-Free Week Really Worth It ? Consumers do not have to pay the state 's 6.35 percent sales tax on the weekend of Jan. 26 through 28 on purchases made at certain businesses in New Jersey. The tax exemption, an annual tradition, applies to purchases of apparel and footwear with an unrestricted sales price of $500 or less. The exemption applies to the following businesses only:
Clothing stores, including factory outlets, and shopping center stores that sell only clothing, shoes and accessories, and do not sell any other items;
Shoe stores and shoe manufacturers' outlet stores; and
Bicycle stores.

column1: How Does a Heat Pump Work - What is a Heat Pump ? Of all the mechanical systems installed in your house, none are as efficient as a heat pump. A heat pump is used to move heat around, not to create heat. The most common use is a furnace. In the winter, heat from inside your house escapes through cracks in walls, ceilings, windows and floors. A heat pump captures this lost heat and transfers it to the rest of the house. This process is accomplished by using electrically-powered fans to circulate a fluid that can absorb and release heat, called the "refrigerant".

WASHINGTON ( AFP ) - US President Barack Obama on Friday ( May 27 ) wrapped up a historic trip to Cuba which opened the way for restored ties with the island after more than five decades of hostility, but warned it was "just a beginning" to a long road ahead. The US leader arrived in the Florida city of Key West at about 5pm local time on Friday, concluding a three-day trip that saw him meet Cuban President Raul Castro in Havana for the first time and deliver a historic address to Cubans calling for greater freedoms and economic reform on the island.

column1: New U.S. Air Force calculations put the 6-ton satellite 's death plunge early Saturday thousands of miles from northwestern North Dakota. The National Weather Service's National Ocean Service says the satellite plunged from orbit at 7:37 a.m. Saturday EDT (6:37 a.m. CDT; 11:37 UTC). The weather service says it is the heaviest U.S. spacecraft to hit Earth. It's estimated that it would have been about 7 feet in diameter (2 meters) and weighed more than 6 tons (5.4 metric tons). The weather service says the satellite "burned up upon reentry, as expected, and no debris hit the ground."

But that lesson was lost Friday on a line that stretched for more than three blocks. column1: Tolls on the San Francisco Bay Area 's seven state-owned bridges will go up by $ 1 starting on Jan. 1. It's the second increase on the bridges in three years, and the money is going to be used to help pay to fix the 75-year-old eastern spans of the Bay Bridge . "There's a reason for it. There was no money for it when we put the bridges together originally, and it's been a long time," said state Transportation Department spokeswoman Melanie Short. "There's no question it needs to be done."
The Board of Supervisors voted Tuesday to sign off on putting a toll increase on the June ballot — not because they support the idea
column2: but because they have a legal duty to give voters the chance to decide on it. The supervisors voted to place on the ballot a proposition to double the price of the Bay Bridge toll as a trial run for a 2012 measure that would raise the toll on the eastern span by as much as $7 to help pay for its construction. The bridge is being replaced by a new span to be built over the water and paid for by car drivers and truckers.

column1: The sovereign debt crisis in the eurozone has dominated the first day of the G20 summit in Cannes . David Lynch and Mark Frost ’ s early ’ 90s series Twin Peaks remains one of TV ’ s unlikeliest cult classics. It was a show that began to take the form of what TV was to be as we came out of its 1970s/ 80s era of 39- minute sitcoms and 2-hour dramas. It was a show so far ahead of its time that there was no context for it. In a post- Mad Men world it’ s an even better watch than it was then. When it was cancelled after two seasons in 1991 it left a whole generation of fans in dismay.

column1: Walking briskly for an hour can cut the genetic effect of obesity , shows study . `` This is the first time walking speed has been looked at with genetic markers, and what it has shown is that walking speed really does matter, '' researcher Dr Andrew Murphy, a senior lecturer in the school of human movement and exercise science at Victoria University, Melbourne , says . " The genetically predicted increase in the waist-to-hip ratio was the same regardless of the speed, but the higher the walking speed and the more energy used , the less of a genetic effect it has . "

column1: FLUSHING , Michigan -- Being blind makes Kris Pierce 's job easier . Pierce , 49 , who works out of his home, has lived with macular degeneration since his early 20s . He lost his central vision in the early stages , but he's been able to live his life as an active, productive adult in spite of his condition . "I can go out to lunch with my wife," he said. "I can still drive, go to the store, take the kids to the zoo. I just don't see them as clearly as I used to, but I do fine."

A newlywed couple in Syria decided to take their wedding photos in the bullet-pocked streets and gutted buildings of the city of Homs, which has been the scene of heavy clashes between government forces and rebels. "They wanted to have their photos in the most unusual place, so they chose Homs," the groom's father told Reuters.

column1: Screen Lupe is a desktop utility that displays a magnified view of whatever is underneath your mouse cursor . It can be used to easily read small text and view small icons, such as those on buttons and dialogue boxes. It's useful if you have trouble reading small print and it can be a big help when you're filling out a form or trying to find and click on a tiny "close" button. Lupe is similar to a magnifying glass but works differently. Instead of magnifying the entire area under the cursor, it magnifies only a small area that is located directly under the cursor.

Chronic constrictive pericarditis ( CP ) is a relatively rare condition in which the pericardium becomes fibrotic and noncompliant
column2: leading to restriction of the left and sometimes right ventricle and ultimately to heart failure. It is characterized by a slowly worsening cardiac tamponade. This syndrome is also associated with a systemic inflammatory process ( e.g.
column3: vasculitis ). CP may occur in the setting of a viral infection
column4: usually associated with a high fever; it may also be caused by certain autoimmune processes. The prognosis in patients with chronic CP is poor
column5: with most requiring heart transplantation.

The outlook for the stock of Future Retail is bullish . The stock surged 4 per cent on Wednesday breaking past Rs 800 level after the company posted 50 per cent growth in its standalone profit in the first quarter of the current financial year. The stock had tanked over 41 per cent since the company posted a loss for the December quarter. This was the second straight quarter when the company has posted a loss. This is mainly because of a one-off non-operational provision of Rs 322.6 crore that was booked in June 2018 related to the Future Group exiting its food business.

WASHINGTON , April 1 , 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- The length of America 's structurally deficient bridges if placed end-to-end would stretch more than the distance from Washington , DC to Las Vegas. One in nine of these deficient bridges (1,500,000 in all) are considered "structurally-critical" meaning that failure of such bridges would have a 'catastrophic' impact on people, business or emergency response operations. While the United States has made progress on improving the conditions of bridges, more needs to be done , according to the 2019 State of U.S. Bridges report from ARCADIS.

A hangnail is a small piece of jagged or torn skin that appears at the very edge of the fingernail or toenail. The skin at the end of the hangnail has become thinner, and as the nail grows outward, it can tear the hangnail. Her speech is slurred, and she appears disoriented. After the shooting, doctors told Blackwell she’d have to use an eye-tracking device to move her lips for at least three months and might never fully recover her ability to speak.

column1: Researchers have identified the remains of the earliest known modern humans to have left Africa . New dating of fossils and stone tools in Israel pushes the known history of the Homo sapiens species back to 215,000 years ago. It is the first time any evidence has been found outside Africa to support a theory, known as the "replacement" theory, that modern humans replaced older ones in the Middle East. The earliest known modern human fossils come from the Jebel Irhoud site in Morocco which is about 300 km (180 miles) west of Marrakech.

The body of a 15-year-old boy has washed ashore in New Smyrna Beach on a day where lifeguards pulled nearly 200 swimmers from the ocean. The child was identified Tuesday by the Volusia County Sheriff's Office. Investigators believe the child's family was on vacation in Ormond Beach and the child may have been swimming with a lifeguarded beach. Authorities are trying to determine if the boy was part of a boat accident. He was found about 20 yards from shore in a shallow area. Authorities say the boy had been missing for about 12 hours before he was found.

Winooski City Manager Josh Handverger has been cleared of charges he created a hostile work environment when he wrote e-mails to a female staffer about her attire and physical features. Handverger had been accused of repeatedly harassing the staffer, but the city’s human relations committee decided that Handverger’s comments were not “unfairly discriminatory or harassing.”
Handverger had said he did not intend to make anyone uncomfortable, and the committee agreed that his behavior had been inadvertent. After the staffer resigned, Handverger told the city’s governing body that he had “misspoke” and his comments had not been meant to be harassing or discriminatory.

column6: relevant

column1: In today 's age of anything-goes flavored vodka , it 's easy to forget the juniper berry roots of all vodkas. The word vodka, in fact, derives from an Old Slavic word for "water." In Russia, vodka remains the drink of choice and it is the one liquor that you can find in every Russian home. Even the Orthodox church in Russia encourages drinking vodka for the sacrament of confession.

SAN RAFAEL , Calif. , May 17 , 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- BioMarin Pharmaceutical Inc. Matthew Levendusky is associate professor of political science at the University of Pennsylvania . He is the author of How Parties Pay for Politics . He can be contacted at ml24@sas.upenn.edu. Electing a Better Congress (Part 2/3)
The second piece in a series on electoral reform. See also part 1 and part 3. There are two ways to reform the rules of political parties: through their internal rules and practices, or through legislation. A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck Sunday morning 551 kilometres northeast of Fairbanks . Alaska 's North Slope was hit Sunday morning in the largest earthquake since the 1989 earthquake . It is also the largest temblor recorded in the central Arctic. The earthquake was felt as far south as Utqiagvik and the National Tsunami Center issued a warning for coastal Alaska following the earthquake Sunday morning. The warning was later rescinded after the tsunami failed to materialise. It occurred on the same fault system where the 1964 Alaskan Good Friday earthquake (magnitude 8.4) occurred.

column1: Following the Fukushima nuclear plant disaster in March 2011
column2: the Japanese population has been understandably concerned about the ongoing impact of radiation released from that accident. A radiation detector called Fukushima Station has been set up near the Japanese capital
column3: Tokyo. It is designed to measure radon gas levels. Radon is a radioactive noble gas produced when uranium and thorium present in rocks degrade. column4: and this has been interpreted by many as evidence of continued danger from radioactive fallout in the area.

This is Digital Life has been linked to Cambridge Ananlytica , a UK data firm that has been accused of improperly harvesting Facebook data.

A panel of international lawyers and academics called on the International Criminal Court yesterday to investigate Britain for alleged war crimes in Afghanistan. column1: Americans feel more stress than ever , a new survey found . Researchers at Carnegie Mellon University found that older Americans report feeling more stressed than any other age group. SAN FRANCISCO ( Reuters ) - A U.S. judge on Tuesday ruled in favor of the National Security Agency in a legal dispute that may affect the government's ability to collect telephone records on tens of millions of American citizens and foreigners living in the United States. In a ruling that is likely to please supporters of the NSA, U.S. District Judge Jeffrey White ruled that the government was not compelled to reveal "the specific means and logic by which telephone numbers are selected for collection." However, White also said that the government could not continue its collection of telephone metadata from U.S. phone carriers without permission from a special court.

column1: Review : Slither | ScreenRant I was really looking forward to watching Slither . It looked like one of those movies that I just couldn’t wait to see, but sadly it was not as entertaining as I thought it might be. Slither just seemed like a cheap remake or reimagining of the cheesy horror flicks of the 1980 s. It had a few creepy scenes, but most of the movie was spent with the audience just waiting to see some kind of gory, gruesome action. Even the special effects were quite cheesy and uninspired. I also felt that the acting was subpar.

column1: Why does psoriasis increase diabetes risk ? Previous research demonstrated that having psoriasis increases the risk of developing type 2 diabetes. The study
column2: published early online in CMAj (Canadian Medical Association Journal)
column3: showed 2.6 times the risk for patients with psoriatic arthritis compared to individuals with psoriasis alone. It is not clear why this happens. It is possible that psoriasis is a manifestation of diabetes
column4: or that it is due to an immune system dysfunction shared by both diseases. Whatever the mechanism
column5: this risk can be mitigated by aggressive intervention to maintain normal glycemic control and to treat coexisting psoriatic disease
column6: the study says.

column1: There is a very big difference between trying to get enough evidence for a criminal charge , president or not, and trying to get enough evidence for a civil case. To prove a civil case you only have to get 10% proof. To prosecute in a criminal court you only need "beyond a reasonable doubt". To prove a criminal case you have to take the person to trial and prove his or her guilt beyond a reasonable doubt. It does not matter how many people were present, it only takes one witness to prove his or her innocence in a criminal court.

column1: ( Newser ) – Navy captains can still dock the pay or shore leave of misbehaving sailors under new rules published by the service Monday. They're also able to order up to 14 days' restriction to the mess for a first offense, while more serious infractions could result in up to three months' restriction, loss of pay, or both. Sounds like a good incentive to get out of the Navy.

column1: This week , Congressshamefully snuck CISA into the omnibus bill , which passed in both the House and Senate . The " Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act " will give the corporations who own your data a license to share any and all information about you with each other, your government and federal agencies. It will even let them sell your personal information to third parties. CISA lets your private and personal information be passed on without any notification to you, and no requirement that the government protect it, and it lets companies sell your information with no notification or control by you .

column1: SOSEONG-RI

column1: FEDERAL Treasurer Josh Frydenberg has warned banks not to foreclose on farmers or hit them with extra fees during the drought and has called on the states to follow suit with similar declarations. column1: Can you use nail polish during pregnancy ? Over the last few years there have been some controversial reports warning pregnant women against the use of nail polish as some studies claimed that it may contain chemicals that are not safe for pregnancy. The chemicals that are of concern are the tri- and quart-based compounds used as the base for the pigment and the chemicals that are used to prevent staining. However
column2: these are not the only chemicals that are used and it is believed that the risk may be negligible and the chemicals are present at such a low concentration that it is unlikely to cause any harm to the baby or the mother.

column1: Bundesliga club Darmstadt said on Wednesday they have sacked German-Tunisian midfielder Anis Ben-Hatira over his work with a controversial Islamic organisation. In this June 17 . 2009 , file photo , former Hollywood private eye Anthony Pellicano is shown in court. AP Photo/Nick Ut. Former Hollywood PI Anthony Pellicano pleads guilty to charges related to illegal phone taps

column1: What will the Minnesota fire season bring ? The drought situation in western Minnesota is not improving; in fact conditions are worsening as we enter June and July. As of this writing we have only 1.91 inches of rain in May.

An Iranian court has sentenced a prominent Iranian-Canadian blogger to more than 19 years in jail , rights groups and relatives said Monday, in what they say is part of an ongoing campaign to stifle dissent. Amnesty International said it fears that Hossein Derakhshan, who was sentenced on Saturday, was tortured or otherwise coerced into making "false" statements. His case has drawn international attention, because of his high profile among Iranian bloggers and because his imprisonment could be an indication that the country is ramping up censorship in the run-up to the presidential election in June.

column1: Pharmaceutical giant Pfizer wiped the floor with Wall Street 's third-quarter estimates , but one comment made by CEO Ian Read on Tuesday was a red flag. "Our portfolio of high value products has continued to grow and in 2014, 17 of our top 20 brands had year over year growth in revenue," Read said on a conference call. This is a red flag because it means that the company relies heavily on drugs like Viagra , Lipitor , and Celebrex . It also means that when those drugs lose patent protection, Pfizer will eventually face the same fate that many pharmaceutical companies have faced recently.

Google has long had a testy relationship with China , with the search giant largely pulling out of the Chinese mainland last year . That came on the heels of increased tensions with Huawei , one of China's most important telecommunications companies, after President Donald Trump put the firm on a list of foreign entities that pose a national security risk to the U.S. The Chinese government has previously denied Google accusations that Huawei has been cooperating with the country's Ministry of Public Security and China Mobile Research Institute in conducting illicit work related to so-called " deep packet inspection ".

column2: Del . - A Kenton cheese plant shut down by the Food and Drug Administration due to a possible link to an outbreak of E. coli infections in Pennsylvania has resumed operations. Eight of the 24 cases of the illness in Pennsylvania are being linked to cheeses from the Kenton-based Gordy's Cheese. The cheeses are being recalled. Officials said Wednesday that the plant has resumed production. FDA and the U.S. Department of Agriculture will continue to investigate the plant to ensure the facility is operating properly.

Maureen Wildes argues it is time to find out the true impact of the Vietnam War on the veterans 'and on us'
Vietnam veterans returned home after their tours of duty to a nation that was still trying to come to terms with the deaths of millions of civilians in the Holocaust. The GI generation that had fought the Axis powers was now the object of widespread protests and often hostile receptions. But for the vast majority of these men and women, this new experience of being reviled and vilified for their military service was an unwelcome and even frightening challenge.

column1: ( Newser ) – After a car fatally hit a 70-year-old pedestrian , the driver 's insurance company sought payment from the deceased man s estate. The insurer s lawyers sent letters to the man's widow, arguing she was responsible because she signed the insurance forms for the policy. It's a tactic that's not unheard of. The practice is known as "assignment," and it's legal in 38 states. It allows an insurer to recover from a third party instead of the person responsible for the accident. "It's legal. It's not ethical."

An American Civil Liberties Union lawyer asked a federal appeals court in San Francisco today to block a California law requiring anti-domestic violence messages in video games rated "mature." A federal district court judge ruled against the law, saying it was too vague, but the California Supreme Court reversed the judge, saying it was not too vague.

column1: Nobody can predict with accuracy when stock markets will end their record-setting bull run . But the best way for investors to be prepared is to start thinking now about what steps to take once a bear market does begin. In the meantime
